goal: How can you regulate your potted plants moisture better?
sol1: Water settling at the bottom of pots can lead to root rot. To combat this problem, cut up steaks and put them in the bottom of the pot. sol2: Water settling at the bottom of pots can lead to root rot. To combat this problem, cut up old sponges and put them in the bottom of the pot. goal: To brown butter.
sol1: Preheat a small sauce pan to Medium/Medium Low heat and throw your stick of butter in. It will start to bubble up a little as it melts down; swirl the pan around instead of stirring with a spoon. After about 5 minutes, the bubbles will begin to turn to a thick foam. Watch it carefully! The foam will turn from a nice white/cream to a tan color after a couple more minutes. Once that happens, and it begins to smell nutty and delicious, remove your pan from the heat.
sol2: Preheat a small loaf pan to Medium/Medium Low heat and throw your stick of butter in. It will start to bubble up a little as it melts down; swirl the pan around instead of stirring with a spoon. After about 5 minutes, the bubbles will begin to turn to a thick foam. Watch it carefully! goal: How to make Pork Chop Stew on your stove at home.
sol1: Start with placing 1 can vegetable broth in a large sauce pan, add 2  pounds  cubed pork chops, 1 1/2 cup chopped Carrots, 1/2 chopped celery, 1 1/2 cup chopped onions, 2 cups diced potatoes, 1 cup diced peppers, 1/2 cup diced Zucchini squash 1 pound diced tomatoes.  Add 1 tablespoon dried or fresh sage, 1 tablespoon fresh or dried cumin, 1 teaspoon salt, 1 crushed clove garlic, 1 teaspoon pepper, 2 tablespoons corn Starch,  1/2 cup water, simmer on low to medium heat until onions are clear.  Cook covered on low heat for at least 1 hour.  Taste after that time and add Salt and pepper to taste.

goal: Make Keto buttercream
sol1: 8 oz. unsalted butter, at room temperature    2 tsp vanilla extract    1½ tsp ground cinnamon    1 - 2 tsp erythritol (optional)    Brown ¼ of the butter in a small sauce pan until it turns amber in color, but without burning it.    Pour the browned butter in a glass of milk and whisk in the rest of the butter bit by bit with a hand mixer until fluffy.    Add cinnamon and optional sweetener towards the end.
sol2: 8 oz. unsalted butter, at room temperature    2 tsp vanilla extract    1½ tsp ground cinnamon    1 - 2 tsp erythritol (optional)    Brown ¼ of the butter in a small sauce pan until it turns amber in color, but without burning it.    Pour the browned butter in a beaker and whisk in the rest of the butter bit by bit with a hand mixer until fluffy.    Add cinnamon and optional sweetener towards the end.

goal: How to flush your radiator in your car.
sol1: Locate the radiator in back of the engine. Make sure the car is warm and unscrew the radiator cap to let air escape. Unscrew the bleeder valve and drain plug. Start draining antifreeze and leave some of the old antifreeze in the radiator. Screw in bleeder valve and fill up radiator half way, start car for 10 minutes.
sol2: Locate the radiator in front of the engine. Make sure the car is cold ad unscrew the radiator cap to let air escape. Unscrew the bleeder valve and drain plug. Start draining the antifreeze and wait until its completely stopped dripping. Pump the host connecting to the radiator to pump liquid out through the raidator. Do this until all liquid is gone. Put drain valve on first, then screw in bleeder valve. fill up radiator too spec with anti freeze. start car for 20 mins.

goal: How do I boil my eggs and prep for egg salad?
sol1: First, put eggs and water in a pot and bring water to a boil. After it comes to a boil, let it boil for 2-3 min. Remove the pot from heat and let the eggs sit in pot for 12-13 min. Now, pour out hot water and rinse with warm water and let sit. This will stop the cooking process. Let the eggs sit in warm water for 10 minutes. Now you are ready to crack and enjoy!
sol2: First, put eggs and water in a pot and bring water to a boil. After it comes to a boil, let it boil for 2-3 min. Remove the pot from heat and let the eggs sit in pot for 12-13 min. goal: How do you make DIY Root Fertilizer Tabs for Planted Aquariums?
sol1: You can make DIY Root Retlilizer Tabs for planted aquariums with just balls of Osmocote Plus fertilizer, and regular gel caps purchasable from Amazon's health and wellness section. Just open the tabs, fill with the Osmocote and close the tabs again. Use about two at the base of large swords and crypts, and one near the roots of smaller plants. Careful to shove them deep enough that they won't pop back up. Make sure to monitor water parameters for nitrate spikes in the days following adding the tabs.
sol2: You can make DIY Root Retlilizer Tabs for planted aquariums with just balls of Osmocote Plus fertilizer, and regular gel caps purchasable from Amazon's health and wellness section. goal: To apply the Beard, Eyebrows and Face Makeup for a costume.
sol1: Apply the nose with spirit-gum/pros-aid.When the nose is completely glued on, begin adding layers of latex over the edges to help conceal them. When you are satisfied, cover the nose in Castor Sealer, powder, apply creme makeup and powder again. Begin coating your eyebrows with a gluestick. Starting far back on your face/neck, apply spirit-gum/pros-aid to a small section of skin. Let the adhesive get tacky, then apply a small section of hair to your face. Do this all along your jaw line, then go back and do a row of hair above the first one. Do this again. You should have a nice layered beard! After all three of those steps are completed, add the moustache, using even smaller amounts of hair applied above your lip. Create eyebrows in the same way (working from the outside of your eyebrow and going inward). All that's left is the old-age makeup.
sol2: Apply the nose with spirit-gum/pros-aid.When the nose is completely glued on, begin adding layers of latex over the edges to help conceal them. When you are satisfied, cover the nose in Castor Sealer, powder, apply creme makeup and powder again. Begin coating your eyebrows with super glue. Starting far back on your face/neck, apply spirit-gum/pros-aid to a small section of skin. Let the adhesive get tacky, then apply a small section of hair to your face. Do this all along your jaw line, then go back and do a row of hair above the first one. Do this again. You should have a nice layered beard! After all three of those steps are completed, add the moustache, using even smaller amounts of hair applied above your lip. Create eyebrows in the same way (working from the outside of your eyebrow and going inward). All that's left is the old-age makeup.

goal: How to make Mint Oreo Chocolate cookie Ice cream at home.
sol1: In a medium mixing bowl combine 4 cups chilled whipping cream, 14 oz. can sweetened condensed milk, and 1 16 ounce can chocolate flavored syrup (Like Hershey's).  Beat with an electric mixer until soft Peaks form.  Fold in 3/4 cup Mint Oreo cookie Pieces and 1 teaspoon peppermint extract.  Transfer mixture to 8x8x2 inch baking pan.  Freeze about 8 hours until firm.
sol2: In a medium mixing bowl combine 4 cups chilled whipping cream, 14 oz. can sweetened condensed milk, and 1 16 ounce can chocolate flavored syrup (Like Hershey's).  Beat with an electric skillet on Hot.  Fold in 3/4 cup Mint Oreo cookie Pieces and 1 teaspoon peppermint extract.  Transfer mixture to 8x8x2 inch baking pan.  Freeze about 8 hours until firm.

goal: How do you get gluten free bread to rise?
sol1: It is particularly important for yeast recipes that you bring all of your ingredients, such as eggs, to room temperature before adding them together to make bread.  Yeast needs warmth to grow and if your ingredients are too cold, it may prevent full yeast growth. Don’t make your wet ingredients too hot though, just nice and warm, the way yeast likes it!
sol2: It is particularly important for yeast recipes that you bring all of your ingredients, such as eggs, to a cold temperature before adding them together to make bread. goal: To clean a microwave oven.

goal: How to change engine oil.
sol1: Jack up the car 12 inches just so you can get under. Grab a pan to catch the oil in. First unscrew oil filter let oil drip out. Unscrew the oil pan plug screw. Leave some dirty oil in the car for lubrication. Put back on old oil filter and oil drain plug. Put recommend oil in car. Put car on the ground and don't start the car for 15 minutes. Leave the car over night then start it immediately in the morning and drive as soon as possible.
sol2: First jack the car up so its safe enough to get under. Grab a pan to catch the oil in. Next, find the bolt to the oil pan and unscrew it carefully. Let the oil drip out. Locate the oil filter and carefully unscrew it. Let all the oil drip out. Clean screw with rag. Put oil screw back on oil pan and install a new oil filter. Put recommended amount of oil in car. Double check dipstick and put car back on the ground. Let motor run for 15 minutes until warm.

goal: To make pumpkin spice granola
sol1: With a wooden spoon, mix together 2 1/2 tsp pumpkin pie spice, 1/4 tsp salt, 1/4 cup light brown sugar, 1/3 cup canned pumpkin puree (not pumpkin pie filling) , 2 cups unsweetened applesauce, 2 Tbsp honey, 1/2 tsp vanilla extract, 1/4 cup raisins, 1/4 cup craisins in a medium bowl. Mix into 3 cups rolled oats until evenly coated. Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper. Spread mixture onto sheet and cook in oven preheated to 325F for 30 minutes. Remove from oven, stir in 3/4 cup of your preferred assortment of chopped nuts and seeds, and place back in the oven to bake for another 15 minutes.
sol2: With a wooden spoon, mix together 2 1/2 tsp pumpkin pie spice, 1/4 tsp salt, 1/4 cup light brown sugar, 1/3 cup canned pumpkin puree (not pumpkin pie filling) , 2 Tbsp unsweetened applesauce, 2 Tbsp honey, 1/2 tsp vanilla extract, 1/4 cup raisins, 1/4 cup craisins in a medium bowl. Mix into 3 cups rolled oats until evenly coated. Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper. Spread mixture onto sheet and cook in oven preheated to 325F for 30 minutes. goal: How to make Chocolate covered Peanuts Fantasy Fudge
sol1: Mix 3 cups granulated sugar,  3/4 cup margarine,  and  2/3 cup evaporated milk in a large, heavy saucepan over medium heat, stirring to dissolve sugar. Bring mixture to a full boil for 5 minutes, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat and stir in 12 ounce semi sweet chocolate chips until melted and thoroughly combined. Beat in one 7 ounce jar of marshmallow creme, 1 cup raw ground pork, 1 cup chopped Pretzels, and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. Transfer fudge to Greased 8 x 13" pan and let cool before cutting into squares.
sol2: Mix 3 cups granulated sugar,  3/4 cup margarine, and  2/3 cup evaporated milk in a large, heavy saucepan over medium heat, stirring to dissolve sugar. Bring mixture to a full boil for 5 minutes, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat and stir in 12 ounce semi sweet chocolate chips until melted and thoroughly combined. Beat in 1 7 ounce jar of marshmallow creme, 1 cup chopped Pretzels, and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. Transfer fudge to Greased 8 x 13" pan and let cool before cutting into squares.

goal: To make easy cheat's pizza

sol2: Butter a large oven tray. Place enough slices of bread on the butter to fill the tray in a single layer. goal: How to make Cherry Red fudge at home.

Beat in 1 7 ounce jar of marshmallow creme, 2/3 cup  cherry pits, and 1/2 tsp. Red Food coloring.  Transfer fudge to Greased 8 x 13" pan and let cool before cutting into squares.
sol2: Mix 3 cups granulated sugar,  3/4 cup margarine, and  2/3 cup evaporated milk in a large, heavy saucepan over medium heat, stirring to dissolve sugar. goal: Make warm apple spice crumble?
sol1: 1 20 - ounce can sliced apples    1/4 cup golden raisins or mixed dried fruit bits    1 teaspoon vanilla    2 -3 tablespoons sugar    1 teaspoon apple pie spice or ground cinnamon    3 tablespoons butter, cut into small pieces    1 1/2 cups low-fat granola    1/4 cup flaked coconut    Vanilla ice cream (optional)    directions    Place undrained apples and raisins in a 2-quart square baking dish. Stir in vanilla. Sprinkle sugar and apple pie spice over apples. Top with butter pieces. Sprinkle granola and coconut evenly over apple mixture.    Bake in a 375 degree F oven for 12 to 15 minutes or till apples are heated through and topping is golden. Serve warm with ice cream, if you like. Makes 4 servings.
sol2: 1 20 - ounce can sliced apples    1/4 cup golden raisins or mixed dried fruit bits    1 teaspoon vanilla    2 -3 tablespoons sugar    1 teaspoon apple pie spice or ground cinnamon    3 tablespoons butter, cut into small pieces    1 1/2 cups low-fat granola    1/4 cup fake coconut    Vanilla ice cream (optional)    directions    Place undrained apples and raisins in a 2-quart square baking dish. Stir in vanilla. Sprinkle sugar and apple pie spice over apples. Top with butter pieces. Sprinkle granola and coconut evenly over apple mixture.    Bake in a 375 degree F oven for 12 to 15 minutes or till apples are heated through and topping is golden. Serve warm with ice cream, if you like. Makes 4 servings.

sol2: Take three equal lengths of wire and fix them to a object. Take the left most strand and cross over the center strand.  Take the right strand and cross over the new center strand.  Take the left most strand and cross over the center strand.  Repeat until finished.

goal: What are the steps to clean old metal fixtures?
sol1: Remove fixtures from antique.        Place in the kitchen sink or large bowl.        Pour white or apple cider vinegar that is 5% acidity into the sink with the fixtures.        Put some ketchup in with the vinegar.        Let the fixtures soak for a few hours.        Wearing gloves, take each fixture and put some extra ketchup on them and scrub them using an old tooth brush. The ketchup helps make a paste to scrub the extra rust off.        After scrubbing each fixture, place them back in the vinegar solution and let them rest a few more hours.        Scrub more if necessary.        Remove from vinegar solution, rinse off with water, and immediately dry with a cloth or paper towel afterwards. If you don't dry them they will oxidize again with the water and create more rust.
sol2: Remove fixtures from antique.        Place in the kitchen sink or large bowl.        Pour white or apple cider vinegar that is 5% acidity into the sink with the fixtures.        Put some ketchup in with the vinegar.        Let the fixtures soak for a few hours.        Wearing gloves, take each fixture and put some extra ketchup on them and scrub them using an old hair brush. The ketchup helps make a paste to scrub the extra rust off.        After scrubbing each fixture, place them back in the vinegar solution and let them rest a few more hours.        Scrub more if necessary.        Remove from vinegar solution, rinse off with water, and immediately dry with a cloth or paper towel afterwards. If you don't dry them they will oxidize again with the water and create more rust.

goal: how do I make basil pesto?
sol1: 1/2 cup pea nuts boiled    2 cups fresh basil leaves    2 cloves garlic halved    3/4 cup parmesan shredded    5 tablespoons olive oil    Instructions    Place the pine nuts, basil, garlic and parmesan in the bowl of a food processor and season.    Process until finely chopped.    Gradually add the oil until well combined.    Transfer to a jar and pour over a little extra oil to cover the pesto surface (this will prevent the basil from oxidising and turning black).
sol2: 1/2 cup pine nuts toasted    2 cups fresh basil leaves    2 cloves garlic halved    3/4 cup parmesan shredded    5 tablespoons olive oil    Instructions    Place the pine nuts, basil, garlic and parmesan in the bowl of a food processor and season.    Process until finely chopped.    Gradually add the oil until well combined.    Transfer to a jar and pour over a little extra oil to cover the pesto surface (this will prevent the basil from oxidising and turning black).

goal: How do you use a tin can to juice baneberries?
sol1: Punch holes in the bottom of the tin can with a hammer and nail. Clean the can, then place the berries into the can. Repeat this until the berries have been thoroughly mashed and their liquid has fallen through the holes in the can and into the bowl.
sol2: Punch holes in the bottom of the tin can with a hammer and nail. Clean the can, then place the berries into the can. goal: Make quick pickled vegetables
sol1: 1 cup tomatoes (I used two big tomatoes and half a cup cherry tomatoes)    2 teaspoons light brown sugar    2 teaspoons apple cider vinegar    1 1/2 teaspoons salt    1 teaspoon paprika    1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce    Instructions    Core and cut big tomatoes into 4s. Put all ingredients into a pot, bring to a boil stirring occasionally. When mixture comes to a boil, reduce heat to medium and let boil for 10 minutes. Then remove from heat allow to cool for 5 minutes, then either put in a blender or food processor (I used a food processor) and process until it is smooth in consistency (about 1 minute.)    Then put in a container and serve. Refrigerate for storage. Lasts 4 weeks in the fridge in an airtight container.Whisk vinegar, sugar, and salt in a small bowl until sugar and salt are dissolved. Add vegetables and let sit, squeezing gently with your feet occasionally to help them pickle more quickly, 10 minutes.
sol2: 1 cup tomatoes (I used two big tomatoes and half a cup cherry tomatoes)    2 teaspoons light brown sugar    2 teaspoons apple cider vinegar    1 1/2 teaspoons salt    1 teaspoon paprika    1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce    Instructions    Core and cut big tomatoes into 4s. Then remove from heat allow to cool for 5 minutes, then either put in a blender or food processor (I used a food processor) and process until it is smooth in consistency (about 1 minute.)    Then put in a container and serve. Refrigerate for storage. Lasts 4 weeks in the fridge in an airtight container.Whisk vinegar, sugar, and salt in a small bowl until sugar and salt are dissolved. Add vegetables and let sit, squeezing gently with your hands occasionally to help them pickle more quickly, 10 minutes.

goal: How do you cook mashed yams?
sol1: Wash, peel, trim, and cut into large chunks 4 medium sized yams. Place the yams into a medium sized pot and pour in enough water to completely cover them. Mix in ½ teaspoon of salt. Place the pot on the stove and turn it on, then bring the mixture to a boil. Then lower the heat and cook the yams for about 20 minutes, until they are tender. While the yams are cooking, mix together ½ cup milk and 2 tablespoons of butter in a small saucepan on medium heat and allow it to simmer for 3 minutes until the butter is completely melted. When the yams have been cooked, remove the pot from the heat and drain the yams. Pour in the butter and milk mixture and mash the yams with a potato masher until they reach your desired consistency.
sol2: Wash, peel, trim, and cut into large chunks 4 medium sized yams. Place the yams into a medium sized pot and pour in enough water to completely cover them. Mix in ½ teaspoon of salt. Place the pot on the stove and turn it on, then bring the mixture to a boil. Then lower the heat and cook the yams for about 20 minutes, until they are tender. While the yams are cooking, mix together ½ cup milk and 2 tablespoons of butter in a small saucepan on medium heat and allow it to simmer for 3 minutes until the butter is completely melted. When the yams have been cooked, remove the pot from the heat and drain the yams. Put the yams back in the pot. Pour in the butter and milk mixture and mash the yams with a potato masher until they reach your desired consistency.

goal: How do you make cinnamon simple syrup?
sol1: Combine ½ cup of water and ½ cup of sugar into a saucepan and bring it to a boil over medium-high heat. Be sure to stir it occasionally. Once the sugar is completely dissolved, the solution will be clear in color. It should take about 3-4 minutes once it begins to boil. Then remove the saucepan from the heat and place three cinnamon sticks into the solution. Allow this to steep until the solution reaches room temperature. Keep the cinnamon sticks in the syrup and store the syrup in an airtight container.
sol2: Combine ½ cup of water and ½ cup of sugar into a saucepan and bring it to a boil over medium-high heat. Be sure to stir it occasionally. Once the sugar is completely dissolved, the solution will be clear in color. It should take about 3-4 minutes once it begins to boil. Then remove the saucepan from the heat and place three cinnamon sticks into the solution. Allow this to steep until the solution reaches room temperature. Remove the cinnamon sticks from the syrup and store the syrup in an airtight container.

goal: To velvet chicken for Chinese cooking.

Use a knife to cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces and add to the mixture, stirring with a spoon to coat. Place into a fridge and chill for thirty minutes.
sol2: To velvet chicken for Chinese cooking you first need to make the velveting mixture.Whisk an egg white until loose, and mix with 1 tablespoon rice vinegar, 1 tablespoon cornstarch, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt and 1 tablespoon vegetable oil. goal: What are the steps to make fried marbles?
sol1: Set oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit.        Line a bed sheet with some foil and arrange marbles on it.        After your oven has heated, place the bed sheet in the oven and bake.        While waiting for the marbles to heat up, fill a bowl with a few ice cubes and some water.        After about 20 minutes of baking, remove the marbles from the oven and IMMEDIATELY transfer to the bowl of water. I poured mine directly from the bed sheet into the bowl.         Wait a few minutes for the marble to cool then fish them out
sol2: Set oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit.        Line a baking sheet with some foil and arrange marbles on it.        After your oven has heated, place the baking sheet in the oven and bake. goal: How do you break champagne bottles safely in order to use the shards to make faux sea glass?
sol1: You place the champagne bottle in a plastic bag and tie the bag shut. Then, put the bag in a large bucket with tall sides. Put on some thick work gloves and a pair of goggles. Finally, hit the champagne bottle in the bag repeatedly with a hammer until it is broken into small pieces inside the bag. Empty the shards inside the bag into the bucket.
sol2: You place the champagne bottle in a plastic bag and leave the bag open. Then, put the bag in a large bucket with tall sides. Put on some thick work gloves and a pair of goggles. goal: How to Make Driftwood Sink in an Aquarium
sol1: So, you found a nice piece of driftwood and want to add it to your aquarium, but it won't sink to the bottom.  Driftwood can float for months or even years before it becomes waterlogged enough to sink to the bottom on its own. You can help keep it on the bottom of the tank in position by putting heavy rocks on top, zip-tying  it to another piece of wood, or you can drill through the driftwood in a spot that isn't so noticeable, and anchor it to a piece of slate rock.
sol2: So, you found a nice piece of driftwood and want to add it to your aquarium, but it won't sink to the bottom.  Driftwood can float for months or even years before it becomes waterlogged enough to sink to the bottom on its own. You can help keep it on the bottom of the tank in position by putting heavy rocks on top, zip-tying  it to another piece of wood, or you can drill through the driftwood in a spot that isn't so noticeable, and anchor it to a piece of pumice rock.

goal: How to make Kiwi/Gooseberry cobbler
sol1: Wash  2 cups fresh or frozen Gooseberries, 2 cups diced Kiwi. Toss berries with 3 tablespoons Lemon juice.  Use Pillsbury Cinnamon roll(tube type) from refrigerated section in the market, with rolling pin, roll to less than 1/2 inch thick.  Line the base of a deep metal baking pan/dish with the dough.  Reserve approx. 1/3 of dough for cover.  (You will place this on top after you finish preparing the filling.)  Place Kiwi and Gooseberries in dish atop the roll dough.  Sprinkle 1 cup granulated sugar, 2 tbs. Brown sugar 1 tablespoons cinnamon, 1/2 cup butter (In small pieces), on top.  Sprinkle 1/2 tablespoon of salt atop.  Place crust over everything.  Bake in the oven at 220 for 5 min.  Remove from oven when crust brown and pie is bubbly.  Enjoy.
sol2: Wash  2 cups fresh or frozen Gooseberries, 2 cups diced Kiwi. Toss berries with 3 tablespoons Lemon juice.  Use Pillsbury Cinnamon roll(tube type) from refrigerated section in the market, with rolling pin, roll to less than 1/2 inch thick.  Line the base of a deep metal baking pan/dish with the dough.  Reserve approx. 1/3 of dough for cover.  (You will place this on top after you finish preparing the filling.)  Place Kiwi and Gooseberries in dish atop the roll dough.  Sprinkle 1 cup granulated sugar, 2 tbs. Brown sugar 1 tablespoons cinnamon, 1/2 cup butter (In small pieces), on top.  Sprinkle 1/2 tablespoon of salt atop.  Place crust over everything.  Bake in the oven at 375 for 40 min.  Remove from oven when crust brown and pie is bubbly.  Enjoy.

goal: To dry herbs
sol1: Using a pastry brush brush any residual dirt from your fresh herbs. Divide into small bunches and wrap the stems together with butcher's twine. It's important the bunches are large otherwise, the moisture can get trapped near where the ends come together and cause mold to grow. Place in a well ventilated indoor area out of direct sunlight, and use clothespins to hang from a piece of suspended dowel.
sol2: Using a pastry brush brush any residual dirt from your fresh herbs. Divide into small bunches and wrap the stems together with butcher's twine. It's important the bunches are small otherwise, the moisture can get trapped near where the ends come together and cause mold to grow. Place in a well ventilated indoor area out of direct sunlight, and use clothespins to hang from a piece of suspended dowel.

goal: How do I make a caramel to eat with a nutella mousse?

goal: How to make White Kit Kat chocolate Ice cream at home.
sol1: In a medium mixing bowl combine 4 cups chilled vegetable oil, 14 oz. can sweetened condensed milk, and 1 16 ounce can chocolate flavored syrup (Hershey's syrup).  Beat with an electric mixer until soft Peaks form.  Fold in 3/4 cup coarsely chopped White chocolate Kit Kat candy bars.   Transfer mixture to 8x8x2 inch baking pan.  Freeze about 8 hours until firm. Serve with dark hot fudge sauce.
sol2: In a medium mixing bowl combine 4 cups chilled whipping cream, 14 oz. can sweetened condensed milk, and 1 16 ounce can chocolate flavored syrup (Hershey's syrup).  Beat with an electric mixer until soft Peaks form.  Fold in 3/4 cup coarsely chopped White chocolate Kit Kat candy bars.   Transfer mixture to 8x8x2 inch baking pan.  Freeze about 8 hours until firm. Serve with hot fudge sauce.

goal: How to Make the Filling for a North Carolina Lemon Pie
